fragments.text: There is no exception thrown by either the client or the server. In Client, when it tries to send the choice to the server using
the server never gets this. Debugging has involved checking to see if the server buffer ever has anything in it to be read and it never does.

informationUnits.rawText: @Mat There is no exception thrown by either the client or the server. In Client, when it tries to send the choice to the server using out.println(choice) the server never gets this. Debugging has involved checking to see if the server buffer ever has anything in it to be read and it never does.

node.contents: @Mat There is no exception thrown by either the client or the server. In Client, when it tries to send the choice to the server using out.println(choice) the server never gets this. Debugging has involved checking to see if the server buffer ever has anything in it to be read and it never does.

fragments.text: I am trying to have a client and server talk to each other using TCP. The original code ran fine until I modified it to add some more functionality. Now when the Client writes to the Server, Server never seems to get any message.

informationUnits.rawText: I am trying to have a client and server talk to each other using TCP. The original code ran fine until I modified it to add some more functionality. Now when the Client writes to the Server, Server never seems to get any message.

Client:Welcome to Cubby!
Select from the options below: The options are then listed.

fragments.text: Server:Server outputs that it is waiting for a client to connect. Then it displays an acknowledgment when a client does connect. Then it does nothing after that. It is supposed to write to the console the choice that was sent by the client.

comments.text: // Easy for debugging; turns sockets on/off
// Client to server socket connection object
// Out prints to the socket
// In reads from the socket
// The port number of the server we are connecting to
//This assumes the server is also run on a local machine
//Out will write to the socket and in will read from the socket
//Read input from the console
//At this point we assume that a TCP connection has been made to the server
//We now ask the user for a username and password.
//If it is the users first time logging in then an account is created.
//Exit the program
//User has access to Cubby at this point
//Operating System stuff
//Create the Cubby folder if it doesn't exist
// talking with server handled in WatchDir
//user requests to quit
//sign off from server

// Hash the password

// Now we need to send the username and hashedpw to the server for validation
// For security, Java recommends setting the plaintext pw to all 0s after use
